page.title: 15Kettlesing - At Prayer
page.content: There are two religious establish- ments within the block. The Anglican church at Felliscliffe (above Kettlesing village) was built in 1897 by local benevolence, and now has no resident minister, but is served by the vicar of Hampsthwaite. Kettlesing Methodist Chapel was re- built in the 1930's, and is opposite the site of the older chapel (now a house) built in 1790, one of the oldest Methodist chapels in Nidder- dale. It reflects the strong Weslyan tradition amongst the former farmer/ weavers. It it believed there were other temporary chapels before this, notably at Longscales, above Kettle- sing. Both churches now suffer from dwindling and aging congregations.
